listitem.para: &selnx; uses security labels, or contexts, to identify and classify processes, files, and other system objects. This labeling system enables precise enforcement of access control policies.
Administrators can define very specific rules for how processes interact with files, directories, and other system resources. This enables granular control over system security.

A zero-day exploit is a cyber attack that targets an unknown software vulnerability. Attackers gain access to a system before a patch or fix is available. &selnx; can help mitigate the impact of zero-day exploits by restricting the action a compromised application can take.
&selnx; provides detailed audit logs, which can be used to track and analyze security events to help identify and mitigate potential threats.
&selnx; helps to maintain the integrity of the operating system and the data by enforcing consistent access controls.
